title: Events Staff Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed, a meeting in my manager's office after class. They wanted to go over my previous experience and ask about why I wanted to work for Huskie Athletics. Honestly working here with such a friendly administrative setting has set my bar too high for other work environments.
Interview Questions: Asked regarding my program at the U of S and my previous experience

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan
Interview Descriptions: I had one interview with two people. It took about a week to get the interview. They asked pretty standard questions, but some of the questions were a bit awkward and artificial. They only had one round of interviews.
Interview Questions: How would you handle conflicting requests

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan
Interview Descriptions: The interview involved a take home interview that took about 4-6 hours + behavioural questions. The take home interview was to design a system that was related to what the job would be.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan
Interview Descriptions: So many questions about the back ground, intention to work as a team, desire to work on a new subject, ability to write paper and thesis, digital design, hardware design, verification, simulation, implementation
Interview Questions: How do you calculate the power consumption using synopsis tool?

title: Communications Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward. Given lots of information, very friendly panel. Great conversation that was informative and really helped you get a feel for the place. They were very honest and open in their answers.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you had to convince someone of the best strategy and how you navigated it.

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Amazing experience and interviewers were very polite and asked reasonable question. They were very knowledgeable and they didn't try to challenge me. I received an offer right after the interview which is rare as most companies wait at least 2 weeks before providing offer.
Interview Questions: Why you are interested in this position

title: Casual Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan
Interview Descriptions: Submit Resume and CV, waited for a few days to be called for an in-person interview. Questions ranged from general to situational questions. The interview was conducted in a relaxing environment.
Interview Questions: Why we would hire you?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Good to go. Direct contact is better. Follow high standards. Require technical skill and they will train you too. Better for learning new knowledge. Better writing and communication skills are very important.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan
Interview Descriptions:
very friendly, short, and right to the point, helpful points, and great staff 
two-step interview - On the phone video call or in-person
easy to learn about the role on their website
Interview Questions: How did you hear about this position?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly PIs with specific questions and discussions about the project which gave an insight to the job. Moreover, they provided some background about the challenges and the necessity to employ a new PDF.
Interview Questions: What are you interested in this position?

title: Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan
Interview Descriptions: normal interview process that one would expect for a position of this level. I was asked to come in and talk to the hiring supervisor.  There were also 3 of the proposed colleagues present.
Interview Questions: what is your experience

title: Business Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview; one hour long. Very respectful, interested, and engaged panel. Gave me a very positive feeling about the university. Dealt with my rejection respectfully and as timely as possible. I still look at their careers page every day.
Interview Questions: What do you know about us?

title: Programmer Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Two managers come to have a interview with you. They will ask you some questions about your program. Also, ask some technical questions. Something like Linux, software concepts and the university courses.
Interview Questions: The working experience and tell them a story about it.

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan
Interview Descriptions: very friendly people aks about your work experience and technical knowledge.  you don't feel any pressure or stress during the interview. it takes shortly to get notified about the result.
Interview Questions: your knowledge and experience

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is as easy as it can get. the people are nice and really helpful to get over your nervousness. The management gives ample opportunities to learn more and more stuff at work and networking skills also eveolve over time.
Interview Questions: describe a situation when you gave good customer service

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: One has to send resumes to professors whose work matches his or her field of interest.  The professor goes through the resumes and decides to call for an interview. Its usually basic questions about skills. The transcripts and published literatures play big role here.
Interview Questions: I was asked about sorting

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Winnipeg, MB) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my application I received an invitation to a Skype interview.  It involved a discussion of my previous research experience as well as my plans for future work.
Interview Questions: How does your previous experience(s) influence how you would approach the research questions in this position?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was over the phone. The interviewer was very interested in learning about my background and asked me a lot of questions related to my teaching experience. The overall interview experience was very positive and pleasant.
Interview Questions: What was the most challenging teaching moment that you have encounter and how did you manage it?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Called in for an interview, met with a panel of 3 people, then they followed up with references and hired me within the week. Apparently I didn't write enough so here are some random words to fill the space.
Interview Questions: Situational question - "how would you handle a parent coming in on behalf of their child (who is a first-year university student)?"

title: Clerical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: First i applied through online and then i got a Phone Interview scheduled by HR and after 2  days they short listed and asking for Face to Face Interview with director
Interview Questions: Why did u apply for this job ? There are a lot of resources out there. Which tools do you find most useful as a clerical assistant ?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my Resume, I asked to meet with the professor taking the course. Talked to him about my background and understanding of the course.  Since I already took a similar course in my undergraduate study, I informed the prof that even though it was quite some time back I took the course, I am very much able to look up the syllabus and understand the topics.
Interview Questions:
Do you have basic understanding of the course? 
Did you take same or a similar course while in University?
Are you able to relate with students ?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Emailed the prof describing my background as a medic prior to coming back to university, detailing my grades at the time, and briefly describing my immediate and future career plans. Had a one hour sit-down interview in his office where he asked a bunch of questions, and was offered a position and told to begin designing my procedures right away
Interview Questions:
Describe why you want to conduct research in this field.
How did you hear of this lab, and why did you choose me specifically as a supervisor
What skills are you familiar with doing, and which don't you know

title: Student Desktop Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for Innovation Enterprise, which belongs to the University of Saskatchewan. There were 2 rounds for the interview process: one was testing your researching/analysis skills where they gave you a random journal and you have to summarize it as well as give some thoughts regarding the potential market; the other one was a 1-to-1 interview. There were 5-6 people in the room and each of them took the turn to ask you a business related questions.
Interview Questions: How're your current skills fit with the job? Any business related experience? How did you overcome challenges during work?

title: Research Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Brief questions about domain and ideas for future projects, Lots of impact on the Project management and project writing skills. Very clear ideas for how to handle research projects and deadlines. Besides that routine questions were asked which were easy to reply.
Interview Questions: Project management and project writing skills

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: It is based on the candidate research experience. The interview was very cordial. If you know your subject then you will be hired. Since I was interviewed for a research position, all the questions were related to the research project. During the interview, both the funding agency and the research coordinator were present along with the PG students working on the project.
Interview Questions: Explain about your research expereince

title: Research Facilitator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was an oral interview. Conducted in the presence of 3 members, excluding me. It was a great experience. Relevant questions to the position were asked. Over all very comfortable and learning experience.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your previous experience?

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Thorough interview. At the interview stage, I was warmly greeted and met with many faculty, staff and and top administration , which was pleasant event. They really seemed interested in an overall good fit for both of us.
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself in five years.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: This is a 30 mins panel interview. They first introduced the project and the expectation for the position, and introduced themselves. Then just round table questions. Questions includes technical and situational questions. Finally, they asked me if I have questions. I waited about 2-3 weeks after the application deadline to get the interview notice.
Interview Questions: •	Understanding of the research project, some technical questions to start, and how to deal with the research problem after understanding the research question?

title: IT Project Manager/Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: As expected, it was a structured interview with a panel of 3 who asked questions one at a time. Ample time was given to answer the questions in a decent setting at the campus. The impression I got at the end was quite positive, however, it did not even progress to the next level. Surprisingly so, since I had more than the # of years of required experience and all the needed certifications, it made me wonder whether they really know what to look for in a candidate.
Interview Questions: Simple technical questions, one scenario based, surprisingly, no behavioral questions, a lot how would you deal with demanding academic staff or a certain situation.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was just OK. I was called about two weeks after applying to set up a time. It was a panel interview with 3 employees from the college which included a supervisor, finance manager and dean.  I felt comfortable during the process and we laughed a few times.  I didn't leave feeling good or bad just glad it was over with.  i was told things in the interview that changed later on when I was in the position though so that was disappointing.  Also, when I showed up for the interview everyone was on their break so I sat in the waiting room for about 10 minutes before someone came up.
Interview Questions: Some of the questions were boring.  I was also given some skills questions on the computer.  I was only given 10 minutes to read a pamphlet and then answer a "fake" email.

title: Front Desk Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, within 2 weeks got a call to fix interview time.  Personal interview with two managers. Friendly interview. First they go through position summary. It was a part time position in residence department. Asked general interview questions.
Interview Questions: Many common interview questions were there like strength, weakness etc. This was something I was not expecting. Do you have any conference services experience?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan
Interview Descriptions: A friend of mine told me this job posting on u of s website. I applied on line and got a phone call a week later. The interview lasted about 20 min and there are basic behavior questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? How do you demonstrate your leadership?

title: Culinary Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was one of the best interviews I had ever, they were really prepared with 4 pages of good questions that allowed me to develop and be very clear in what my opportunity areas are and my qualifications.
Interview Questions: How do you handle working with people with special needs?

title: Clerical Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: It took around one hour. Pretty easy questions strengths weakness, past experience and how I can do the job. How flexible I am and I was provided with few duties. I was asked how comfortable I am doing those. It was good experience I learn a lot
Interview Questions: Standard questions

title: Journal Voucher Approver Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied on the university website and I got an email back with an interview invitation . The interview was very soon after I received the email. I interviewed with 3 personnel which I thought would be intimidating but the interview went so well that I believed they will offer me the position. The interview felt more like a conversation rather than an interview and it was my best interview ever (that's because my bosses were amazing people)
Interview Questions: They asked about fund accounting

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a friendly meeting with my former supervisor. We had a long relation before this position, which started five years earlier to my start date as a postdoctoral fellow. Usually the postdoctoral fellow interview process is not difficult. It was a friendly meeting with my former supervisor. We had a long relation before this position, which started five years earlier to my start date as a postdoctoral fellow. Usually the postdoctoral fellow interview process is not difficult.
Interview Questions: What is your career goals? Do you want to stay after one year? Do you want to be a professor or work for the industry? What is your career goals? Do you want to stay after one year? Do you want to be a professor or work for the industry?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was brief for the TA of CE 318 applied engineering mathematics. The instructor asked me a little about the content and did I have any TA experience. And he also mentioned his plan to teach the course since it was his first year to instruct this course.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with the course material?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan
Interview Descriptions: Basic questions regarding academic background, future career plans, why I am interested in pursuing graduate studies, how I would be able to fit in with the work culture etc etc
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions:
panel interview with some coworkers and management lasted about an hour 
questions from skill base and behavioral 
ensure you google and look at the top interview questions that is what is being asked.
Interview Questions: describe the time you had to deal with a trouble employee and what was the outcome.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: There was one interview with three members on the interview panel. The interview lasted 45 minutes and was fairly generic. It was important to brush up on the players in the department and what the overall goal was/is for the division.
Interview Questions: If you could have dinner with anyone in the world, dead or alive, who would it be?

title: Cafeteria Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Saskatchewan (Saskatoon, SK) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Emailed my resume, called me a couple of days later. Scheduled an interview for the next day. Gavve me an offer and I accepted it. Went back to sign papers 2 days later.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at the UofS
